divs: sighting detailsat 12:45 am july, 5 2012 i was leaving for work and, as i was closing my driveway gate, something orange in the sky caught my eye. i should note at this point that fireworks were still being shot at the time, however, i can say with 100 percent certainty this was not a firework. it was a spherical, orange glowing orb floating across the horizon. the best way i can describe it is like a large, translucent bag with convoluted flames contained inside. size\distance away is hard to judge, but it seemed like it was very high up(guess 1 mile or more). size from my point of view would be comparable to the moon. the ball traveled in a straight line toward the northeast, until it was no longer visible behind the treeline. it crossed the horizon in about 20 seconds (appeared to be moving slow for it's perceived size, if that makes sense- kind of like watching a very high airplane move across the sky. there was no sound, winds were calm from what i remember. i first thought it was paper from a firework on fire, then realizing it was too far up, thought it may have been a shuttle launch. however, it had no trail, and the shape was orb-like from my perspective. it was very bizarre, to say the least. i have seen many meteors, and this, i don't believe was one. i have never seen anything like it in my lifetime, and it is hard for me to describe in words. thanks for you time.
Summary: Spherical orange fireball slowly crosses night sky
